intro: Hieracium markovanum, commonly known as the Marko's hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, exhibiting a rosette of basal leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
